metadata.title: CVE-2021-23215 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.description:
An integer overflow leading to a heap-buffer overflow was found in theDwaCompressor of OpenEXR in versions before 3.0.1. An attacker could usethis flaw to crash an application compiled with OpenEXR.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23215` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr24 - 2.3.0-6ubuntu0.5+esm1
openexr - 2.3.0-6ubuntu0.5+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openexr package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-6ubuntu0.5+esm1').
